overview: The 'tragedy competition' was the first part the Greek dramatic competitions where the playwrights at the time competed with each other. This video production of 'Tragedy Competition' introduces 11 actors: each of them is placed in a made-up situation with which they must figure out a way to deal with their own interpretation. It is up to the actors to stay within the situation or leave, but the last actor to continue to speak and cry becomes the winner of the competition. The whole production is unrehearsed and is filmed in real time.
title: Tragedy Competition
